title: Finally, retirement age of medical specialists to be gazetted
byline: Following unrest and uncertainty regarding the unpublished gazette on the retirement age of medical specialists, which risks the premature retirement of over 200 specialists, the Ministry of Public Administration has decided to take steps to publish the gazette notification, Daily Mirror learns.

title: 13 killed after Navy speedboat collides with ferry near Mumbai
byline: An Indian Navy speedboat that was undergoing engine trials lost control and collided with a passenger ferry off the Mumbai coast today. The navy in a statement said 13 people including a naval officer and two people from the original equipment manufacturer were killed in the accident.

title: Passport crisis brews further, Govt appoints committee to seek solution
byline: The crisis involving the issuing of passports brews further with the available number of copies being sufficient only till July next year.

title: CID launches probe into alleged human trafficking under ‘E8 visa’ scheme
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has launched an investigation into the alleged E-8 visa scandal of sending persons for employment to South Korea.

title: Preparations underway to welcome President during visit to China: Chinese envoy
byline: Preparations are underway to warmly welcome President Anura Kumara Dissanayake during his future visit to China, Vice Chairperson of the National Committee of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference (CPPCC) Qin Boyong said.

title: PCR and Antigen test kits imported by unregistered company: Minister
byline: PCR and rapid antigen test kits have been imported to Sri Lanka by a company which has not been registered with National Medicine Regulatory Authority (NMRA) during the COVID 19 pandemic period, Parliament was informed today.

title: Will export energy to BIMSTEC countries: Foreign Minister
byline: Claiming that no agreement which betrays the country was signed with India, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said today the agreement on power grid connectivity aims to export excessive energy generated in Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lanka name a strong squad for New Zealand T20Is
byline: Led by Charith Asalanka, the squad remains unchanged from their home series against the Black Caps back in November.

title: GCE (O/L) 2024 (2025) exams date announced
byline: The Examinations Department today announced the date for the 2024 (2025) GCE Ordinary Level (O/L) examinations.

title: Gazette notification to specify vehicles permitted for import
byline: A gazette notification will be issued specifying the types of vehicles permitted for import under the first category, effective from today.

title: Delhi pollution: Cold air and toxic haze affect millions
byline: Delhi’s pollution has once again soared to hazardous levels, with a top expert warning that India’s toxic air will have a bigger impact on public health than the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Sri Lankan authorities rescue over 100 Myanmar emigrants lost at sea
byline: A multi-day trawler carrying more than 100 suspected illegal emigrants lost its course and drifted towards the sea off the Mullivaikkal coast in Mullaitivu.

title: Govt increases daily allocation for preschool breakfast to Rs. 100
byline: The government has approved increasing the daily allocation to Rs. 100 to provide breakfast for children attending Early Childhood Development Centres and preschools, Cabinet spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Man arrested for driving in wrong direction on Southern Expressway
byline: A man was arrested by the expressway police yesterday for driving a vehicle in the wrong direction on the Southern Expressway (E01), the Expressway Operation, Maintenance and Management Division said.

title: Court issues arrest warrant on Gnanasara Thera over absence on judgment day
byline: The Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today issued a warrant for the arrest of Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) General Secretary Ven. Galaboda Aththe Gnanasara Thera for failing to appear before court on the day the judgment was to be delivered over a case filed against him.

title: Sri Lankan jailed for murdering wife with axe in front of their children
byline: A Sri Lankan man has been sentenced to 37 years in jail for murdering his wife with an axe in front of their teenage children, in what a judge has described as a brutal and horrific attack.

title: Sri Lankan man charged for alleged sexual assault on international flight
byline: A Sri Lankan man faced Broadmeadows Magistrates Court today (19 December 2024) charged with allegedly committing an act of indecency on board an international flight.

title: Sajith still to submit educational certificates to Paliament: Nalinda
byline: Opposition leader Sajith Premadasa has not submitted his educational certificates to Parliament as yet, despite his claims of tabling them in Parliament yesterday, Cabinet spokesman Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Sri Lanka Police to get Rs. 300 Mn worth of vehicles
byline: Cabinet approval was granted to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between India and Sri Lanka to acquire vehicles for the Sri Lanka Police under an Indian grant.

title: The media is not to blame, Prime Minister!
byline: Last week, the government faced a diplomatic blunder when Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya accepted a consignment of school uniforms from China and ended up thanking the ‘Republic of China’ which Taiwan is officially known as instead of the ‘People’s Republic of China’, in the presence of the Chinese Ambassador and other officials.

title: Bangla Tigers lift Lanka T10 Super League Title
byline: Hambantota Bangla Tigers produced a fine all-round performance to beat Favourites Jaffna Titans by 26 runs in the Inaugural Lanka T10 Super League Cricket Tournament final encounter played at the Pallekele Stadium in Kandy.

title: Names of more politicians who obtained money from President’s Fund to be released
byline: Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today he will release the list of politicians who had obtained money from the President’s Fund apart from the list of politicians he revealed in Parliament on Wednesday.

title: Only one firearm per person will be issued for personal protection: MOD
byline: The Ministry of Defence said that it has decided to issue only one firearm per civilian for personal protection and it will be issued after considering intelligence reports.

title: Cardinal commends Govt. over Easter Sunday probe
byline: Archbishop of Colombo, Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith, said he is confident and optimistic that the incumbent government will bring justice to the Easter Sunday bomb victims by uncovering the truth.

title: Masked woman questions MP Kottahachchi about hidden assets in Uganda
byline: A masked woman was seen questioning NPP MP Nilanthi Kottahachchi about whether their government plans to recover stolen assets allegedly stashed in Uganda as mentioned by her during the election campaign period to woo votes.

title: Update issued on India and Pakistan hosted matches at ICC events
byline: ICC Men’s Champions Trophy 2025 to be played across Pakistan and a neutral venue

title: Newly appointed Minister’s eligibility to Parliamentary seat challenged
byline: Another writ petition has been filed before the Court of Appeal seeking an order declaring that the Minister of Rural Development, Social Security and Community Empowerment, Dr. Upali Pannilage, is disqualified from being a Member of Parliament (MP) and therefore not entitled to hold office as an MP.
